greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G. J. Chaitin's numbers of s-expressions of size n are given by the coefficients of polynomials p(k, x) satisfying p(k, x) = Sum[p(j, x)*p(k - j, x), {j, 2, k - 1}]. The coefficients of these polynomials give the triangle shown here.
comment: Row sum sequence: Table[Sum[CoefficientList[p[n, x], x][[m]], {m, 1, Length[CoefficientList[p[n, x], x]]}], {n, 0, 15}] {0, 1, 1, 1, 2, 4, 9, 21, 51, 127, 323, 835, 2188, 5798, 15511, 41835}
reference: G. J. Chaitin, Algorithmic Information Theory, Cambridge Univ. Press, 1987, page 169.
maple: p := proc(k,x) option remember ; if k = 0 then 0 ; elif k= 1 then x; elif k= 2 then 1; else add(p(j,x)*p(k-j,x),j=2..k-1) ; fi ; end: A124027 := proc(n,k) coeftayl( p(n,x),x=0,k) ; end: printf("0, 0, 1, ") ; for n from 0 to 18 do for k from 0 to n-2 do printf("%d, ",A124027(n,k)) ; od: od: # _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 08 2007
mathematica: p[0, x] = 0; p[1, x] = x; p[2, x] = 1; p[k_, x_] := p[k, x] = Sum[p[j, x]*p[k - j, x], {j, 2, k - 1}]; w = Table[CoefficientList[p[n, x], x], {n, 0, 10}]; Flatten[w]
xref: See A097610 for another version. Cf. A072851.
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Oct 31 2006
